chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Laver Sample was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No use or possession of alcohol of illegal drugs.
No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Restitution set at $0.00.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Laver Sample

records.addlTxt: Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Milton L. Childs, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's Motion for Sentence Credit and for Amended Judgment of Conviction.  (Terrence L. Sample - #293292, Racine Correctional Institution, PO Box 900, Sturtevant WI 53177).
Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing P.M. (20 pages) commencing 09-01-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Terrence Laver Sample.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 122 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No use or possession of alcohol of illegal drugs. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Cooperate with the department. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Restitution set at $0.00.


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Addendum to the Plea Questionnaire

Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Terrence Laver Sample not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for today's proceedings.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Wourms.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.

Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not available. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Terrence Laver Sample in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrence Laver Sample appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
